definition: to die as in the line of duty (idiom)

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to be buried with the dead/to die for a cause

sentences.english: Whether our lovable party did die in line of duty this professor locates the martyr?
sentences.chinese: 我們可愛的黨是否把這位因公殉職的教授定位烈士呢？

sentences.english: He died on the job while repairing a streetlamp.
sentences.chinese: 他在修路燈時因公殉職。

sentences.english: More than 800 officers were killed in the line of duty last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年一年有超過800名警察因公殉職。

sentences.english: I remember the day his partner, his best friend was gone down in the line of duty.
sentences.chinese: 他的同伴，同樣也是他最好的朋友因公殉職。
